page.title: 10BLACKMORE VALE VEGETATION
page.content: These large open fields have in the main been cleared of trees to make ploughing more practical.The hedgerows are planted mostly with blackthorn, hawthorn and hazel bushes but have some fine oak and beech trees planted in them.One area of about 12 acres of cultivated woodland has mostly oak and ash trees but there is also an area of newly planted beech saplings protected from rabbits by plastic tubes. Dutch elm disease killed many fine trees in this area most of which have been cut down.There is very little evidence of replanting. As many fields are re-seeded with grass every two or three years the wild flowers have become much scarcer. Few poppies or ragwort but hedgerows still support the bramble,wild rose, honeysuckle,clematis,stinging and dead-nettles,comfrey and scabious.
